    • Method Detail

      • getNextMove

        public MovementData getNextMove()
        Searches for the next move that the computer should do. NOTE: Computationally expensive.
        Specified by:
        getNextMove in interface ArtificialIntelligence
        Returns:
        A MovementData that contains information on what move the computer should do next.

      • minMaxSearch

        protected MovementData minMaxSearch(int depth,
                        int width)
        Uses the miniMax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning to decide the next move the computer should do.
        Parameters:
        depth - The depth to search to.
        width - A limit on how wide the tree should be.
        Returns:
        A MovementData that contains information on what move the computer should do next.

      • evaluate

        protected double evaluate(Board board)
        Evaluates the state of the board using an evaluation function of Value(Board) = (blackCaptures-whiteCaptures)+.1*manhattanDistanceOfKing. Higher values are good for black, lower values are good for white.
        Parameters:
        board - The Board to apply the evaluation function on.
        Returns:
        The value of the evaluation function applied to board.

      • findManhattanDistance

        protected int findManhattanDistance(Board board,
                        Token king)
        Finds the manhattan distance between the king and the closest corner of the board. Does not take into account tokens that may be in the way.
        Parameters:
        board - The board that king is on.
        king - The token to find the manhattan distance to the corner, presumably the king.
        Returns:
        The manhattan distance from king to the closest corner of board.
